column1: ## This file contains the classification of amino acids with respect to different
## chemical properties as defined in Table 1 from Hanada, Gojobori and Li, Radical
## amino acid change versus positive selection in the evoultion of viral envelope
## proteins, Gene, 385:83-88, 2006. The header line contains column names for the
## amino acid, three-letter nomenclature and all the different chemical properties
## which are grouped by Hanada et al. (2006) into polarity and volume (NeutralSmall,
## PolarSmall, PolarLarge, NonpolarSmall and NonpolarLarge), charge and aromaticity
## (Acidic, NeutralNonaromatic, NeutralAromatic and Basic) and charge and polarity
## (NeutralPolar, AcidicPolar, BasicPolar and Nonpolar). Each of the subsequent rows
## is associated to a amino acid where the first value specifies its IUPAC 1-letter
## code, the second its full name and the third its 3-letter code. The rest of the
## values each row are logical (TRUE/FALSE) and assign membership to the corresponding
## chemical property. This file can be read and parsed with the function
## 'readAAradicalChangeMatrix()' from the VariantFiltering package. This function builds
## a squared symmetric matrix with as many rows and columns as amino acids and contains
## logical values set to TRUE whenever the amino acid change implied by row and column
## is considered radical and FALSE when considered conservative. Amino acid changes
## within a chemical property are defined as conservative and radical otherwise.
